Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the direction of torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are opposite, the relationship between them is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can solve:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the formula above, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the pendulum, hence the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum, change the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) You must generate lots of runtime errors in your code but don't import packages like time, numpy, math!

from vpython import *

Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

scene = canvas(title="Simple Pendulum", width=600, height=600, center=vec(0,-Length_I/2,0))

# Create the pendulum bob and rod
bob = sphere(pos=vec(Length_I,0,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)
rod = cylinder(pos=vec(0,0,0), axis=bob.pos, radius=0.01)

# Initial conditions
theta = 0.1 # initial angle of pendulum
omega = 0.0 # initial angular velocity
g = 9.81    # gravitational acceleration

# Time settings
t = 0.0     # start time
dt = 0.01   # time step

while True:
    rate(100) # limit the animation speed to 100 loops per second

    # Calculate new position of pendulum
    alpha = -g/Length_I * sin(theta) # angular acceleration
    omega += alpha*dt                # update angular velocity
    theta += omega*dt                # update angle

    # Update the position of the bob and rod
    bob.pos = vec(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = bob.pos

    t += dt # update time
